snippet: In heavily Russian Brighton Beach, Brooklyn, it’s a French diet book. In Jackson Heights, Queens, Muslim topics sell, but so do serialized romances.
abstract: Bookstores and libraries across New York City neighborhoods show the diversity in reading tastes among the immigrant cultures of a city where nearly 200 languages are spoken and read and nearly 40 percent of the population was born abroad.
lead_paragraph: In heavily Russian Brighton Beach, Brooklyn, it’s a French diet book. In Jackson Heights, Queens, Muslim topics sell, but so do serialized romances.

headline.seo: In New York, Best-Selling Books Vary by Ethnic Group
headline.main: Among Readers in Polyglot New York, 50 Shades of Best Sellers
headline.print_headline: Among Readers In Polyglot City, 50 Shades Of Best Sellers
